Package com.littlesaints.protean.functions.trial

Class Trial<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.littlesaints.protean.functions.trial.Trial<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.function.Supplier<java.util.Optional<T>>
    public class Trial<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.function.Supplier<java.util.Optional<T>>
     Functional way to re-attempt failures. It supports configuring a re-attempt strategy and can perform a phased-backoff on continuous failures.
 It's a Supplier that re-attempts failed attempts to generate/retrieve/supply a value, based on the defined Strategy.

 It does all the complex state management and tracking of failures, so the application can focus on it's business logic.

 Usage:
 
     Trial<Integer> trial = Trial.of(Strategy.DEFAULT, () -> {
         Integer result = 1; //retrieve / calculate value
         return result;
     });
 

 Instances of this class are NOT thread-safe. However, they can re-used after invoking the 'reset' method.

 Null value returned from an operation is considered an empty response and an Optional.empty() is returned.

 Note for interpreting the available statistics:

 If the very first trial succeeds, it doesn't count towards either attemptedTriesWithYield or attemptedTriesWithDelay
 Hence, the total attempts made by a Trial instance will be one more than the sum of attemptedTriesWithXXX metrics.
    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    Strategy, Try

      • ofNullable

        public static <T> Trial<T> ofNullable​(Strategy strategy,
                                      java.util.function.Supplier<T> op)
        Creates a Trial with the given Strategy and an Operation that needs to executed. The operation is considered success, if it resulted in a non-null value.

      • ofOptional

        public static <T> Trial<java.util.Optional<T>> ofOptional​(Strategy strategy,
                                                          java.util.function.Supplier<T> op)
        Creates a Trial with the given Strategy and an Operation that needs to executed. The operation is considered success, if it resulted in a non-empty Optional.

      • of

        public static <T> Trial<T> of​(Strategy strategy,
                              java.util.function.Supplier<T> op,
                              java.util.function.Predicate<T> successfulOpTest)
        Creates a Trial with the given Strategy and an Operation that needs to executed. The operation is considered success, if it resulted in a value that tests positive with the given predicate.
